text: Pope Gregory XI (; 1331 –27 March 1378), born Pierre Roger de Beaufort, was a French cleric of the Roman Catholic Church and the 202nd Pope from 1370 until his death. "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2011-11-29. He was the seventh and last of the popes who lived in Avignon in France. == Early life == Pierre Roger de Beaufort was born in 1331 in Limousin in France.Society for the Diffusion of Useful Knowledge. (1838). "Gregory XI," Penny cyclopaedia, Vol. 11, p. 446. The Rosier or Roger family were important in Limousin in central France.Arms of the Roger de Beaufort ; retrieved 2011-12-1. Beaufort was a nephew of Pope Clement VI."Pope Gregory XI", Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2013-3-21. ==Cardinal== Clement VI raised Beaufort to the rank of cardinal in 1348. == Pope == Cardinal Beaufort was elected pope in 1370; and he chose to be called Gergory XI. He was ordained as a priest on January 4, 1371; and was crowned pope on the following day, January 5, 1371 In 1377, Gregory XI was persuaded by Catherine of Siena to return to Rome. "Gregory XI (1329-1378)," Who's Who in Christianity; retrieved 2012-7-18. He reestablished the papacy in Italy. Gregory is also remembered as the Pope who condemned John Wycliffe. ===Western Schism=== When Gregory died on March 27, 1378, the cardinals in Rome elected an Italian-born pope named Urban VI as his successor. In Avignon, the cardinals elected a French-born pope who they named Clement VII. The Western Schism begins with the dispute between the supporters of the Italian-born pope and the French-born pope. ==Related pages == * List of popes * List of popes from the Roger family * Avignon Papacy ==References== ==Other websites == * * "Gregory XI", Encyclopædia Britannica, 1911 * Catholic Hierarchy, Pope Gregory XI * Cardinals of the Holy Roman Church , Cardinal Roger de Beaufort Category:French popes Category:1331 births Category:1378 deaths
